description: The first section is in the forest, with very limited view. The trail is well maintained thought. At 3km, reach a very popular junction, keep rigth will bring you to the ink pots where you have an extensive view. Another 10 km in the forest brings you to a well signed fork where you finish your assent towards the campground. The lake is worthed!Be aware that, after the intensive rain period in 2013, that a portion of the train as been washed out. The park has built an alternative path in the wood. Look for it on your right, at about kilometer 15.
directions: Park at Moose meadows parking lot, unless you want to through a crowd of people in Johnston canyon. It's big enough for every one, but there is no outhouse
title: Luellen lake
